titleStmt.title: William A. M. Van Bokkelen to James F. Robinson
CWG7801

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1862-1863

creation.placeName: Virginia City, Storey County, Nevada Territory

body.p:
Virginia City
Storey County
Territory of Nevada
Nov 15th 1862
To His Excellency
J. F. Robinson
Gov of Kentucky
Sir
I would respectfully apply to you for the appointment of Commissioner of Deeds with power to administer oaths and to take depositions and affidavits to be used in your state
At present I hold commissions from several of the states and territories, and designing to make this my special business, desire to possess if possible a commission froom your state.
I have the honor to enclose the endorsement of Gov. James W. Nye of this territory, and to refer to the Hon. J. J. Crittenden through whose hands this will reach you.

Yours respectfully
Wm A. M. Van Bokkelen
